State Transition Diagram Start.description: Adds a basic Start-> State -> Stop template sequence to the current context within the State Trasition Diagram. This can also be used for sub-states. Note, the length of the line can be forced to change size by adding/removing extra dashes

State Transition Diagram Stop.description: Adds a basic Start-> State -> Stop template sequence to the current context within the State Trasition Diagram. This can also be used for sub-states. Note, the length of the line can be forced to change size by adding/removing extra dashes

State Transition Diagram State.description: Adds a state definition to the current context. Sub-states or concurrent states are defined between the {...} brackets. Note, to specify state data, use the state value details snippet.

State Transition Diagram Transition.description: Adds a transition between two states. The transition may optionally declare a message and/or condition, and/or a transition stereotype. Note, the length of the line can be forced to change size by adding/removing extra dashes

State Transition Diagram Concurrency.description: Adds a concurrency separator within the current state context such that an object can be modeled to be active in multiple sub-states at the same time

State Transition Diagram State Value Inf.description: Adds a current key/value pair to the first compartment of the state, such that it is differentiable from other states in the hosting container
